reviews.title: Great support
reviews.text: You are informed over a month before your Bond matures and the various options are written out cleary. If you decide to remain and reinvest in their recommended deal you do not have to do take any action and the money is reinvested and the certificate is posted to you a month later. If there is any queries and staff are very helpful and obliging either whether you are face to face or on the phone. I find it very helpful as I know the deal they offer is pretty good and I do not hae to take any action.

reviews.text: I gave renewed my mortgage with YBS for the last 12 years as I always find them to offer the best fixed rates around.

reviews.title: DO NOT GO WITH YBS
reviews.text: DO NOT GO WITH YBS Spent 11 years with a YBS mortgage. Was told the mortgage deal would expire on a certain date, agreed the completion of our house on that same day and fined over £1K for early repayment. Thanks YBS, treat you loyal customers like that and you won't have any customers. DO NOT GO WITH YBS

reviews.title: straightforward simple and easy to use
reviews.text: I have a YBS mortgage and i have nothing but praise for YBS and its customer service. every time I have had to contact them by phone the mortgage customer service have been really helpful and have always helped sort out what i needed. I also like the simple and straightforward list of mortgage products they have including offset mortgages. this choice is very helpful. Please keep it up! i will be remortgaging soon.

reviews.title: Been with them 2 years and plan to stay

reviews.title: Have been great

reviews.title: Customers at their heart.
reviews.text: I found that YBS certainly have customer satisfaction and customer experience at the very heart of everything they do. Every contact I have had both taking out my mortgage and updating my mortgage has been nothing short of excellent. I will always be a loyal customer of YBS. Big named banks simply cannot compete

reviews.title: Trustworthy
reviews.text: I have been a customer for over 10 years and can honestly say is it continues to be a positive experience

reviews.title: Excellent service and products
reviews.text: YBS offers a fantastic range of good value products and I am especially pleased with the family offset mortgage account which allows my to give my daughter a helping hand whilst still retaining control of my money and achieving excellent value for the family.

reviews.title: No hesitation in recommending
reviews.text: Easy to apply for, straight forward process

reviews.title: Best financial institution for mortgages
reviews.text: YBS have the best customer service department, completely sympathetic when in times of trouble. Have managed to turn around arrears to being ahead on mortgage with their help and understanding. Couldn't recommend more highly than this. Was a very long & stressful period of years but we turned this around together and they were fabulous.

reviews.title: Just a great provider, great products and services
reviews.text: Simply I trust them to do the right thing, I trust they will not try to take advantage of me, trust that I don't have to keep checking they are not taking advantage of me. Alongside this great products and services

reviews.title: Great product, great service
reviews.text: When taking out the YBS mortgage, we were moving from having shared ownership arrangement on our home to buying the full 100%. It had been a long time coming and there were extra hoops to jump through. YBS was brilliant. I was able to start the process online with a mortgage in principle but then switch to speaking to a mortgage advisor to ensure our specific set of circumstances were understood. I found it really helpful to be able switch between online and speaking to someone, because we could fit the mortgage process around our own lives and work commitments. Thanks YBS.

reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
reviews.text: I have been with YBS some 20 years and have always found them to be excellent. When changing products they are knowledgeable and really helpful. Wouldn't consider leaving.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.text: Really happy with the fixed mortgage we took. The member of staff we dealt with kept us informed of developments which reassured us that we were a valued customer.

reviews.title: The Yorkshire Building Society has always been easy to deal with and their customer service whenever I have had to deal with them has been faultless. I have no hesitation in recommending them.
reviews.text: From the initial re-mortgage to YBS to doing additional lending for home improvements and the subsequent product transfers when the current products needed renewing, I have always been treated well, efficiently and I’ve had the confidence knowing that my custom is appreciated compared to how I have felt when using banks who seem to class customers as punters who are there to be profited from.

reviews.title: Excellent service
reviews.text: Very friendly, easy to apply and complete smoothly. It was a piece of cake to remortgage our house.

reviews.title: Rubbish
reviews.text: Calling the Mortgage Customer helpline was the worst experience ever,total lack of empathy and understanding, after I lost my job there was no help available after they kept me on the phone for ages, just pointed me to the CAB, clearly reading from a scrip.

reviews.title: Worst customer service ever
reviews.text: My former partner and I have a mortgage with these sharks. My former partner still lives in the property and sadly she had a major stroke and cannot walk, read, write or speak properly . Customer services did not want to know and are now threatening legal action including repossesion rather than grant her a 2 week extension. Disgraceful company.

reviews.title: Offset mortgage
reviews.text: My whole experience from applying for to day-to-day management of the mortgage has been brilliant. Staff at the Yorkshire are brilliant and always happy to answer questions about the product. A refreshing change, well done YBS!

reviews.title: So rude, totally put off using them!
reviews.text: I called the Yorkshire Building Society to check some things prior to arranging a meeting with one of their advisers in branch for a mortgage application, but the man was so rude, instead of listening to my query and attempting to help in any way, he was abrupt and did not seem interested in assisting me. I've no patience for such appalling customer service, I'll be going elsewhere.

reviews.title: Superb service
reviews.text: The Yorkshire were really supportive when we were looking for our mortgage. We sometimes struggle with understanding financial stuff and this being so big a purchase we found them really helpful and patient.

reviews.title: Easy website, helpful staff in their call centre area.

reviews.title: Very simple app to use and good interest rate at 5.2%
reviews.text: I have 2 cash ISAs with YBS - the only thing I dislike is that they close the account and stop you putting any more in it quickly, however now I know this, I'll just wait until I have the amount I want to save each year. Great interest rate of 5.2% on one of them and the app is really simple to use.

reviews.text: A very good building society with an excellent range of products offering decent interest rates. Their customer service is good but it is simple to manage your accounts online.

reviews.text: Saw Isabelle who explained everything we needed to know transacted our business in a superb businesslike manner and completed two new investments in less than twenty minutes. What a pleasant experience

reviews.title: Great customer service
reviews.text: This building society really looks after its Customers, I feel like I am really valued as a Customer rather than just a number in a call centre.

reviews.title: This pathetic organisation is either xenophobic or racist
reviews.text: This pathetic organisation is either xenophobic or racist. My wife decided to open a cash ISA and to transfer part of her existing cash ISA balance as the interest rates were higher than her current ISA. Submitted her application and went through the ID checks conducted by external company. Was then contacted by their HQ asking lots of questions about her background, some of which were very strange but they advised this was part of their standard checks. She asked if there were any problems and was advised there wasn't but they would contact her if they had any further questions. When she hadn't heard from them but the account still hadn't been activated by them she recontacted and they informed her they were still awaiting the ID check, which was rubbish of course as this had already been completed and confirmed. She asked to speak to someone else and was then kept waiting for a few minutes before being cut off. I can't image that a so-called 'professional' organisation could be so incompetent and I'm sure their action is due to the fact that she was not born in the UK, although she has been a British citizen for many years. She's now opened an ISA elsewhere who welcome non-British born customers.

reviews.title: Great rates and service
reviews.text: So simple - easy and intuitive. Ready to open and use online

reviews.text: I have saved with YBS for years. They have good rates with knowledgeable friendly staff. The company cares and is transparent. Honesty goes a long way.

reviews.text: First time user to Yorkshire why a great rate and easy to access online

reviews.title: Good value products
reviews.text: I originally had my savings with N&P who were taken over by Yorkshire BS. Since then i have been amazed by their saving products, rates and service. They offer a wide range of saving products with good interest rates. Their is easy to use and apply for products. Excellent service.

reviews.title: no problems
reviews.text: Found it easy to take this out online. Interest rate was good and it was a quick and easy process. All documents received from them quickly. No branch near me but I dont expect to have to visit them as all contact will be online

reviews.title: Great interest while it lasts!
reviews.text: Saving interest rates are poor these days, and when my ISA matured, after checking comparison sites found that Yorkshire Building Society were offering the best interest rate at that time - a market leading 2% per annum! I made an appointment at the branch office and the adviser couldn't have been more helpful. She arranged the transfer from my old ISA account, all the paperwork went through satisfactorily and the documents arrived in good time. The ISA fixed-rate bond matured at 18 months, but I was extremely disappointed to see that the YBS were only prepared to offer derisory interest rates of 1.2% for a new 1-year bond, or 1.3% for 2 years. The Bank of England rate hasn't changed within the time that I have held this account, and I couldn't understand why the building society were offering such poor rates on maturity of bonds. Were they hoping that customers would accept their poor offer and lose out on a better rate? It seemed mean to me! I have (again) checked comparison rates, and am in the process of transferring the ISA account to a financial institution which values their customers. My husband will also do the same when his YBS ISA matures shortly. Because of Yorkshire Building Society's lack of loyalty to customers, they are going to lose out on a considerably amount of money! I advise customers to vote with their feet!

reviews.title: Useful product, ok overall
reviews.text: I have an instant access ISA. It's useful to have it, and it works well for me, but as mentioned by a few other reviews on here, the interest rate could be better

reviews.title: Great Rates from a Caring Mutual Building Society.
reviews.text: They always seem to have very good rates of interest and keep me informed of new saving schemes. When I arrange, on-line, to transfer a large amount of money to another person’s account, they went out of their way to make sure that it was legitimate, without me feeling that they were interfering, not some anonymous text warning!

reviews.title: The customer support is really first class.
reviews.text: The customer support is really first class. Their online support is second to none and I wish we'd used them years ago

reviews.text: I received stunning service at the London branch this afternoon from Courtney Linley-Lavin. She calmly negotiated the verification of my ID and my mum's, sorted everything out and answered every question before I could ask it. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Competitive interest rates
reviews.text: Interest rates are competitive and increased as base rate increases

reviews.title: Transparency
reviews.text: I have banked with a few banks and have had savings with them over the years, but none of them come close to the customer care and transparency of Yorkshire Building Society. Every single month they write and explain about their interest rates, product changes, how they are doing as a company and anything that is new. Everything, whether good or not so good is explained clearly and with absolute transparency, this is something that feels good when they are caring for your money.

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: It was a great experience opening a Savings account in person at my local YBS. Friendly and professional Staff who fully explained the process to me. I've now also opened two ISAs online using the YBS app which I found was very user friendly.

reviews.title: Frequent raises
reviews.text: YBS have been excellent passing on all the interest rate rises and website is easy to use too. Have been a member for over a year now and think entitled to a few preferential products too so all good.

reviews.title: Rubbish building society
reviews.text: Disgusting bank, treats vunerable adults with no care, taken cards away so forced use rubbish books, staff lazy clueless and ceo same no reply to complaints, do not use ybs go else where disgusting place to bank

reviews.title: Yorkshire continue to have great products for both new and existing members
reviews.text: They constantly raise their interest rates for existing products to keep them competitive and also provide outstanding exclusive savings to reward loyal members.

reviews.title: Falsely promise interest rate increases and ignore emails
reviews.text: Yorkshire BS promised to 'Increase the interest rate on the majority of its variable rate saving accounts by at least 0.25%on the 5th April' I left funds in two variable rate accounts on the basis of this promise. For several days after the 5th April I checked the rates, which did not increase. Looking at all the variable rate accounts, I found that the only one to go up was a childrens account. This is certainly not an increase to the majority of variable rate accounts. I emailed all this information to them a week ago, asking for an explanation. I pointed out that the false promise has cost me money as I would have transferred both accounts to a bank offering much better rates a month ago. They have ignored my email. The false, fraudulent promise is STILL coming up on their website. Make your own decision as to whether this is a company you wish to trust with your savings. I am closing both accounts and will look into reporting them to the relevant authority.

reviews.title: Misuse of the word "loyalty"
reviews.text: I don't get it. They launch a "loyalty" ISA for existing customers. Then the next year they launch another one with the exact same name with a better rate. The rate on the old one doesn't go to the new rate. And if you have the first one, when it ends, it kicks out into a standard ISA. There is no easy way to change that or request it goes to the new loyalty one with the better rate. When you question it they just tell you how to transfer to another provider. So the ISA we've held with YBS since ISAs wer invented, they suggest we move somewhere else? If it wasn't irritating, it would just be laughable, it feels like the basis for an essay question in a customer service course....

reviews.title: Withdrawn Direct Debit Facility
reviews.text: I've been with YBS for 20 years and they've suddenly decided to withdraw all Direct Debits and Standing Orders. They've told me I can use Switch to move them to another bank account, but it's not possible from my YBS account. I'll have to phone 30 different companies and change everything over, really bad service wouldn't recommend them to anyone and I'll be closing all my accounts and moving my mortgage to a different lender. Avoid at all costs

reviews.title: Outstanding customer service
reviews.text: I hold several accounts with different banks and building societies, but by far the friendliest and most helpful is the Ashton-Under-Lyne branch. Never had an issue with them and they have always done what I requested.

reviews.title: YBS Group has the best services
reviews.text: Their life insurance is very reliable

reviews.title: Always friendly
reviews.text: Whenever i need to contact YBS Wetherby, they are always so helpful and friendly. Nothing is a bother. A great advert for Yorkshire values

reviews.title: Great products, services and rates
reviews.text: I've always been pleased by their products and rates, but have been especially pleased with their member loyalty products. It's why I save with a building society.

reviews.title: Strong Communications
reviews.text: I've been a long standing customer of YBS and have used several of their products over the years. In particular, really like their email communications regarding new saving accounts, keeping me informed on a frequent basis. I have also received telephone calls providing more information when required and answering any queries in a helpful, friendly fashion.

reviews.title: Apparently dazed
reviews.text: Happy says since with them, bank branches always close by. Thank you for giving me the opportunity to bank with you lovely bunch.

reviews.title: Always Their for you.
reviews.text: Like having a best friend look over you when leaving your finances to Yorkshire Building Society. Trust and Reliability from the first £1 of investment of my first pocket money to Mortgage and 3rd House purchase. A Society to be relied upon. No sleepless nights always fully informed through good times and tough times. Thank You for being personal.

reviews.title: Tastes just like dairy yoghurt

I think they care about their customers and want to keep updating plus being friendly efficient as well.

reviews.title: Brilliant customer service

reviews.title: Untrustworthy
reviews.text: Lost documents supplied, claimed they had responded by email and hadn’t. Long delays in response if they even bother to respond and terrible customer service.

reviews.title: Great people to deal with

reviews.title: Products & People

I know I will always be given factual information in order to make the right decision for myself. I recommend the YBS to family and friends knowing they will be given five star service and a five star product to match.

reviews.title: Amazing customer service
reviews.text: Staff that are empathetic, compassionate and treat you like a friend. Highly recommended

reviews.title: Fantastic service in all aspects
reviews.text: Always go the extra mile, doesn’t matter who you get. Real people who take the time to get to know you and understand what you need. Fantastic and especially through COVID-19. They do not get enough praise and treat everyone as an individual and don’t send them to a machine! I don’t know what it is about YBS but they employ the friendliest people on the planet. Great company and proud to be a member

reviews.title: Fabulous company
reviews.text: Amazing, friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.title: Amazing staff
reviews.text: Whenever we have visited a branch we have always found the staff to be attentive and helpful.

reviews.title: Superb service!
reviews.text: Caring, professional, knowledgeable staff make this the best financial institution on the high street. Honestly can’t be beaten on service and are always very competitive with their products.

reviews.title: Really good service
reviews.text: Really good service in branches only need a lot of improvement on thier online & telephone service but recommend to open a/c in branch

reviews.title: Untrustworthy Building Society as they lose documents
reviews.text: I applied for a mortgage with Yorkshire Building Society and it was proceeding until they lost all the documents I sent to them including my Driving Licence, my payslips and my utility bills. This was despite the fact that they initially stated that they had them. Furthermore, the staff were rude and unhelpful. I was also going to invest some savings with them but I won’t do this now as they give extremely poor customer service and they are unhelpful and rude. My advice is to apply for a mortgage or invest money elsewhere as this organisation do not carry out what they promise to do. Very poor.

reviews.title: Rude staff and lack of diversity awareness
reviews.text: Having some money to invest, I visited the Yorkshire Building Society at Bristol where I live with my partner. The person I spoke to was vague and rude and my partner (who is not from this country)was made to feel uncomfortable by the way she was treated and spoken to. It was a terrible experience and it showed a lack of diversity awareness. I felt that I could not invest with the Yorkshire Building Society due to this terrible experience and I wonder just what attitude this Society has towards customers.

reviews.title: Crass stupidity or what?
reviews.text: YBS wanted six forms of identity to verify the ID's and address of my wife and myself (3 each) during the process of setting up a savings account. YBS rejected three of them. For example, I sent our local authority's council tax demand for the current year to verify my address (which is also oddly enough the same as my wife's). I redacted the amount of council tax to be paid for the simple reason that that information is none of YBS business; I am simply verifying my address. Other than that, the document verified my address, the council's address, the date etc. YBS then wrote to us to state that three of the forms of ID/address that we used were unacceptable, including the above. Of course, that YBS letter used our ID's and address, which YBS said we had been unable to confirm!! (Wait till you try its satirically named 'Customer Services'. YBS can be crassly inept over the phone as well as via the post). It really is time that consumers stopped using foolishly over-officious, banks/building societies like this. Credit it or not, there is a BS in the Midlands that among the few methods by which my 16 year old son could prove his ID/address was possession of a shotgun license!

reviews.title: Dreadful experience
reviews.text: Dreadful experience. I had a house sale fall through so put money in an instant access account. The sale then came through unexpectedly so I tried to withdraw the money I had put in 2 days earlier I was informed by a dreadful, surly and rude customer service agent that I couldn't for 14 days due to money laundering laws. I was advised by Lloyds bank this is not true and if I could prove where the money was from they couldn't keep it but they did. I have now had to go overdrawn and beg and borrow money to complete on my sale while this awful company holds onto my money! When talking to the awful customer services agent who was rude and unhelpful I asked to make a complaint she said she rejected the complaint without me even putting one in! Dreadful company I will take my money they are holding for ransdom asap then close my account and never use again.....BEWARE

reviews.title: Easy access accounts, poor value vs great value.
reviews.text: I have been a Halifax customer for over 40 years and I have several easy access accounts with the them which are paying just 0.05%. I recently visited Yorkshire building society where I have an account and was pleasantly surprised what they are offering for their easy access accounts. 0.85% if you open an account with £1000 and 1.00% if you open an account with £10,000. I will slowly be moving my money over to the Yorkshire BS. Loyalty certainly does not pay.

reviews.title: Very friendly branch service
reviews.text: Very friendly branch service. Internet savings accounts very easy to operate

reviews.title: Brilliant and could offer more.
reviews.text: They are fair with their savings approach and products are great. YBS really considers customers needs first. They are so fair in their approach and service I just wish they’d start offering their own current accounts and credit cards.

reviews.title: Excellent customer service
reviews.text: I was trying to invest money left to me after my mother died. The staff were extremely sympathetic and helpful. The interest rate In the recommended account is favourable.

reviews.title: Lovely friendly people
reviews.text: Very friendly and reliable people.

reviews.title: Friendly helpful building society
reviews.text: I can really recommend the Yorkshire Building Society because they have always been friendly and helpful. Good customer service goes such a long way!

reviews.title: Easy to use website and friendly customer services
reviews.text: I never have any trouble with the website and if I have a query they answer the phone promptly and are helpful and friendly. I don't get frustrated with them as I always I do with my bank.

reviews.title: Great rates
reviews.text: YBS has not only got competative rates, the service in branch is excellent.

reviews.title: Friendly and knowledgable staff
reviews.text: Really good local branch, with pleasant, friendly staff. Good range of products

reviews.title: Good rates, easy online service
reviews.text: Easy to use account online. Good interest rates. Would recommend.

reviews.title: Helpful for childrens savings accounts
reviews.text: Helpful staff when setting up/changing childrens savings accounts

reviews.title: Banking with a smile
reviews.text: Caring about the individual with personal service every time.

reviews.title: Great Bank
reviews.text: Used multiple of there products and always had great service, results and care.

reviews.title: AT least unethical decision to close an old regular savings account
reviews.text: Suddenly announced that an old regular account was not only variable on the interest rate paid but also that they could get away with ending the bonus rate which had been paid for some years. To add insult to injury they closed the account, moved balance into a new account favourable to them as still with the old single access. I am in the process of moving my accounts elsewhere.

reviews.title: yorkshire building society
reviews.text: I operate this account all online and have never had any problems

reviews.title: Lovely people
reviews.text: i have been using this building society for more than 20 years and the staff know us by name and always ask after our family members and how we are doing , do loads of charity work for chosen charities and so very helpful at getting the best returns possible that we are happy to use a most pleasant and effecient place

reviews.title: Friendly, Efficient and helpful
reviews.text: I would just like to say that the staff at our local branch of the Yorkshire Building Society are always welcoming, friendly and helpful. I am very happy with the service I receive. My daughter recently misplaced her ATM card and the staff were very kind and sorted out the problem immediately and efficiently. It was a very simple procedure without any fuss and she had a new card within 3 days. Excellent service :D

reviews.title: Banking in a good way ...........
reviews.text: The staff at the Yorkshire Building Society in Prestatyn branch are second to none. They always make you feel valued and go out of their way to help you. It feels like banking in a good way, and not just about profits and large salaries and bonus for bankers. I also recommend their online banking, it is very easy to use and for me so far trouble free.

reviews.title: Great mortgage and great staff
reviews.text: ADVICE ON SAVINGS & MORTGAGE ALLOWED ME TO PLAN AND PAY OFF MORTGAGE SEVERAL YEARS EARLY SAVED ME '000'S
